content:
TITLE: Python Request to FlareSolverr API
DESCRIPTION: Python example using the requests library to interact with FlareSolverr. The code sends a POST request to the API to fetch a URL with Cloudflare protection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flaresolverr/flaresolverr/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import requests

url = "http://localhost:8191/v1"
headers = {"Content-Type": "application/json"}
data = {
    "cmd": "request.get",
    "url": "http://www.google.com/",
    "maxTimeout": 60000
}
response = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=data)
print(response.text)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Docker CLI Command for FlareSolverr Deployment
DESCRIPTION: Docker run command to deploy FlareSolverr as a container. This sets up the service on port 8191 with info-level logging and automatic restart policy.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flaresolverr/flaresolverr/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run -d \
  --name=flaresolverr \
  -p 8191:8191 \
  -e LOG_LEVEL=info \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  ghcr.io/flaresolverr/flaresolverr:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Bash cURL Request to FlareSolverr API
DESCRIPTION: Example of a Bash cURL command to make a GET request through FlareSolverr. This demonstrates how to use the API to fetch a webpage bypassing Cloudflare protection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flaresolverr/flaresolverr/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -L -X POST 'http://localhost:8191/v1' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
  "cmd": "request.get",
  "url": "http://www.google.com/",
  "maxTimeout": 60000
}'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: PowerShell Request to FlareSolverr API
DESCRIPTION: PowerShell example to interact with FlareSolverr. Uses Invoke-RestMethod (irm) to send a POST request to the API with JSON data for fetching a URL protected by Cloudflare.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flaresolverr/flaresolverr/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
$body = @{
    cmd = "request.get"
    url = "http://www.google.com/"
    maxTimeout = 60000
} | ConvertTo-Json

irm -UseBasicParsing 'http://localhost:8191/v1' -Headers @{"Content-Type"="application/json"} -Method Post -Body $body
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Python Package Dependencies for FlareSolverr
DESCRIPTION: This requirements.txt file lists all Python package dependencies needed for the FlareSolverr project to run properly. It includes core packages like bottle for web serving, selenium for browser automation, and platform-specific dependencies that are conditionally installed based on the operating system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flaresolverr/flaresolverr/blob/master/requirements.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
bottle==0.12.25
waitress==3.0.1
selenium==4.15.2
func-timeout==4.3.5
prometheus-client==0.17.1
# required by undetected_chromedriver
requests==2.32.3
certifi==2024.07.04
websockets==11.0.3
# only required for linux and macos
xvfbwrapper==0.2.9; platform_system != "Windows"
# only required for windows
pefile==2023.2.7; platform_system == "Windows"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example FlareSolverr GET Response - JSON
DESCRIPTION: Sample response from a FlareSolverr GET request showing the solution object containing URL, status, headers, cookies and other metadata.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flaresolverr/flaresolverr/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "solution": {
        "url": "https://www.google.com/?gws_rd=ssl",
        "status": 200,
        "headers": {
            "status": "200",
            "date": "Thu, 16 Jul 2020 04:15:49 GMT",
            "expires": "-1",
            "cache-control": "private, max-age=0",
            "content-type": "text/html; charset=UTF-8",
            "strict-transport-security": "max-age=31536000",
            "p3p": "CP=\"This is not a P3P policy! See g.co/p3phelp for more info.\"",
            "content-encoding": "br",
            "server": "gws",
            "content-length": "61587",
            "x-xss-protection": "0",
            "x-frame-options": "SAMEORIGIN",
            "set-cookie": "1P_JAR=2020-07-16-04; expires=Sat..."
        },
        "response":"<!DOCTYPE html>...",
        "cookies": [
            {
                "name": "NID",
                "value": "204=QE3Ocq15XalczqjuDy52HeseG3zAZuJzID3R57...",
                "domain": ".google.com",
                "path": "/",
                "expires": 1610684149.307722,
                "size": 178,
                "httpOnly": true,
                "secure": true,
                "session": false,
                "sameSite": "None"
            },
            {
                "name": "1P_JAR",
                "value": "2020-07-16-04",
                "domain": ".google.com",
                "path": "/",
                "expires": 1597464949.307626,
                "size": 19,
                "httpOnly": false,
                "secure": true,
                "session": false,
                "sameSite": "None"
            }
        ],
        "userAgent": "Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/5..."
    },
    "status": "ok",
    "message": "",
    "startTimestamp": 1594872947467,
    "endTimestamp": 1594872949617,
    "version": "1.0.0"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: JSON Response for Sessions List from FlareSolverr API
DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response from the 'sessions.list' command in FlareSolverr API. Shows the active browser sessions currently managed by the service.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flaresolverr/flaresolverr/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "sessions": [
    "session_id_1",
    "session_id_2",
    "session_id_3..."
  ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example Prometheus Metrics Output - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Sample Prometheus metrics output showing request counters and timing metrics from FlareSolverr.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flaresolverr/flaresolverr/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# HELP flaresolverr_request_total Total requests with result
# TYPE flaresolverr_request_total counter
flaresolverr_request_total{domain="nowsecure.nl",result="solved"} 1.0
# HELP flaresolverr_request_created Total requests with result
# TYPE flaresolverr_request_created gauge
flaresolverr_request_created{domain="nowsecure.nl",result="solved"} 1.690141657157109e+09
# HELP flaresolverr_request_duration Request duration in seconds
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Prometheus Request Duration Metrics Example
DESCRIPTION: Example Prometheus metric output showing request duration histogram buckets, count, and sum for domain 'nowsecure.nl'. Includes metric type definitions and help text.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flaresolverr/flaresolverr/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: prometheus
CODE:
```
# TYPE flaresolverr_request_duration histogram
flaresolverr_request_duration_bucket{domain="nowsecure.nl",le="0.0"} 0.0
flaresolverr_request_duration_bucket{domain="nowsecure.nl",le="10.0"} 1.0
flaresolverr_request_duration_bucket{domain="nowsecure.nl",le="25.0"} 1.0
flaresolverr_request_duration_bucket{domain="nowsecure.nl",le="50.0"} 1.0
flaresolverr_request_duration_bucket{domain="nowsecure.nl",le="+Inf"} 1.0
flaresolverr_request_duration_count{domain="nowsecure.nl"} 1.0
flaresolverr_request_duration_sum{domain="nowsecure.nl"} 5.858
# HELP flaresolverr_request_duration_created Request duration in seconds
# TYPE flaresolverr_request_duration_created gauge
flaresolverr_request_duration_created{domain="nowsecure.nl"} 1.6901416571570296e+09
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Python Dependency Specification for WebTest
DESCRIPTION: Specifies WebTest version 3.0.0 as a required dependency. WebTest is a Python package used for testing WSGI-based web applications, providing utilities for making requests and examining responses.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flaresolverr/flaresolverr/blob/master/test-requirements.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
WebTest==3.0.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Changelog Items in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Markdown bullet points listing changes, fixes, and updates for a FlareSolverr release.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flaresolverr/flaresolverr/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
* Add challenge selector to catch reloading page on non-English systems
* Escape values for generated form used in request.post. Thanks @mynameisbogdan
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining FlareSolverr Version in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Markdown header defining the version number and release date for a FlareSolverr release.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flaresolverr/flaresolverr/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## v3.3.21 (2024/06/26)
```
